elements.title: Thromidia catalai (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the starfish Thromidia catalai (pictured) can weigh as much as 6 kilograms (13 lb)?

elements.title: West Virginia Music Hall of Fame (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the first exhibit of the West Virginia Music Hall of Fame came from founder Michael Lipton's record collection?

elements.title: funeral of King Mindon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the senior Burmese princes could not attend the funeral of King Mindon since they had all been arrested?

elements.title: Carmine Savino (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 1958, New Jersey assemblyman Carmine Savino proposed cutting property taxes in half by imposing a three-percent state sales tax that would be used to cover public school costs?

elements.title: Homo Sapienne (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Greenlandic novel Homo Sapienne was written in only one month?

elements.title: Marquis Theatre (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when the Marquis Theatre was completed, some Broadway performers boycotted it because of a controversy over the construction of the hotel above it?

elements.title: magma travelling through dykes (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that magma travelling through dykes usually solidifies before it gets to the Earth's surface?

elements.title: Time, Love, [and] Memory (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jonathan Weiner explains in his book how Time, Love, [and] Memory became associated with specific fly genes?
